ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Broad-scope 10M seeds Xmx6G 64-Bit JVM: OOME: GC overhead limit exceeded
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi ... That s very good to know. Is it possible to publish one of these optimised configuration files? We are very interested in performing large crawls. ...

From: Juergen Umbrich <juergen@...>
Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Broad-scope 10M seeds Xmx6G 64-Bit JVM: OOME:
 GC overhead limit exceeded
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=362973207


--------------030106050505020606030601
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8; format=flowed
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

Hi
> We've run many crawls that collect hundreds of millions of URIs over 
> weeks (though usually from a smaller number of seeds), so this should be 
> working for you, at least if the configuration is optimized.
>   
That's very good to know.
Is it possible to publish one of these optimised configuration files?
We are very interested in performing large crawls.

> The "GC overhead limit exceeded" variety of OOME is somewhat unique: it 
> doesn't actually mean that the VM tried and failed to allocate memory, 
> but rather that it decided it was spending a hopeless amount of time in 
> garbage collection (something like >98% of all VM time, IIRC). There is 
> some obscure JVM option for decreasing that threshold, but clearly, if 
> this OOME is being hit, something is wrong -- something allocating an 
> extreme amount of short-lived objects, such that more time is spent 
> GCing than anything else.
>
> Some diagnostic questions and comments:
>
> (1) What version of Heritrix are you using?
>   
Heritrix-2.0.1 (sorry that i forgot to mention it)
> (2) What changes from the default, bundled crawl configurations have you 
> made? (Alternate implementation classes, different setting values, etc.?)
>
>   
copied the broad_but_shallow sheets config.
root:controller:frontier:min-delay-ms=int, 1000
only HTMLExtractor

no other changes!

(Attached the global sheet)
> (3) With BloomURIUniqFilter, have you changed the default sizing 
> parameters (se in Heritrix 1.x by system properties) any?
>
>   
no.
> (4) Can you send full thread stacks (as in the 'Threads Report' or 
> dumped to the _out.log when the JVm process is sent a -SIGQUIT) of the 
> threads, ideally after the crawler has markedly slowed but before the 
> OOME occurs? (After the OOME might be interesting too; in both cases we 
> might get a clue as to what's overwhelming the JVM with GC activity.)
>   
sorry, we deleted the crawl. But I think we can reproduce error and 
provide you with the thread reports.

The _out.log files are available at
http://www.umbrich.net/heritrix_out.log1
http://www.umbrich.net/heritrix_out.log2
http://www.umbrich.net/heritrix_out.log3

Please not that in our seed list are some error lines integrated (the 
lines have a RDF-NQuad format)
(Just know i recognise all the warnings from the 
org.archive.util.iterator.RegexpLineIterator, and i have in mind that 
the regex handling with java can cause serious problems. Could this be 
the reason for the GC thing?)
> (5) On a quad-core with that much RAM you could probably run with many 
> more threads; we often use 150-200 on dual-core machines with only 4GB RAM.
>
>   
Good to know, the avg load during the crawl was around 4 and all cores 
were working.


Best juergen
> - Gordon @ IA
>
> Juergen Umbrich wrote:
>   
>> Hi all,
>>
>> we started yesterday evening a large crawl (10M seed URIs, 100 threads, BloomURIUniquFilter) on a server with the following setup:
>>  ubuntu 8.04 server, quad core XEON 2.33GHz, 8GB RAM
>>
>> and the java version
>>  java version "1.6.0_06"
>>  Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.6.0_06-b02)
>>  Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 10.0-b22, mixed mode)
>>
>> Heritrix was started with the webui and  JAVA_OPTS=" -Xmx6G"
>> bdb-cache-percentage:60
>>
>> after around 5 hours (timestamp 2008-10-23T01:25:12Z in progress-statistics.log) the whole crawling process was slowing down
>> and another 40 minutes later we run into a "java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: GC overhead limit exceeded" error message:
>> After the exepction occurred the crawling is trying to pause
>> The most of the toe-threads are in the state
>>    in processor: 
>>     ACTIVE for 9h17m23s171ms
>>     step: ABOUT_TO_RETURN_URI for 9h15m21s608ms
>>
>>
>> Anyone else run into these problems for a large crawl and a big seed set?
>> And any ideas how we can solve this problem? 
>> 	switching to 32-bit JVM?
>> 	decreasing the Xmx?
>> 	using different modules?
>> 	changing the bdb-cache-percentage to 20? 
>>
>> Best juergen
>>        
>> alerts.log
